channel.title: Anti-Leech
channel.description:
Hello agan sorry for having a new topic but im stumped agan ( i still need help with my first problem lol )
Anyway i want to start giving the client away but I have no clue how to get anti leech on a client.
I have seen some people use an automatic uploader so that when the owner compilles it everyone elce gets an automatic update. If someone could tell me how or a link that would be wonderfull.
Also it is not a webclient yet im makeing a downloadable one :) If that helps at all
Lovya Moparscape! ;D

item.title: Anti-Leech
item.dc:creator: @d_man103456 d man103456
item.description:
@d_man103456 wrote:

Just make the client how you want it, so that it has all of the features you want. Then compile it and then go into a file and screw something up on purpose then compile again to make sure that you receive errors from your compiler. Then when you run your client it will be the same because the compiler will not compile your .java files if you have errors. I would recommend not removing a bracket because it become to obvious with 100 errors and it would be too easy for someone to fix. You could Jar your client with JARmaker which makes it about 100 times harder to decompile the server than if you just delete the class files.

JARmaker link:http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/products/utilities/jarmaker/JARMaker.zip

If you need a tutorial I’m pretty sure there is one on Youtube.

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-Leech
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

The only anti-leech you can do, is on the source. Or, change around the methods names to confuse someone. Or make it a jar and obfuscate it.

Read full topic

So im just tryin to get a antileech on a client to connect to my serv if i compille the server and make like delete random { } from the java the clent should still run im hopeing that will work im gona try th .jar thing though i still dono what .jar will do

item.title: Anti-Leech
item.dc:creator: @supra_s supra s
item.description:
@supra_s wrote:

  1. Remove the .java files
  2. Jar ur client (makes it way harder to decompiler ur client)
  3. There is something so only ur client can connect to your server dont know how that works tought use google for it

i guess thats one of the “best” protections u can add

Read full topic
